intro: Helminthia humifusa, commonly known as the groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lobed or toothed. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Helminthia humifusa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
